title: Stadion Goce Delčev
content:
The Goce Delčev Stadium (Macedonian: стадион "Гоце Делчев") is a multi-purpose stadium in Prilep, North Macedonia. The total capacity is 15,000 (5,684 seats with a VIP/Media capacity of 400)[2] and is named after the revolutionary leader Goce Delčev. It is currently used mostly for football matches and is the home stadium of FK Pobeda and FK 11 Oktomvri. The stadium has been used as an alternative home ground of the Toše Proeski Arena for the North Macedonia national football team and has hosted the Macedonian Cup final on two occasions.[3]
In 2021 Goce Delčev Stadium was completed renovated after 5 years.[4]
